title: Junior Infrastructure Engineer
description: We are looking for a talented Server Infrastructure Engineer to join our multi-tenant hosting team. As a team member for our server team, you'll provide design and implementation support of our large x86 server infrastructure in the US and the UK. You'll build and manage complex data center interoperability and configuration. Additionally, you'll troubleshoot performance issues that require hands-on experience with OS Support (VMware, Windows, Linux), Servers (Blade, rack-mount), storage, and networking. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work</strong>.<p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p>This position features three different starting points, based upon prior experience. All relevant backgrounds are considered.<p><br></p><em>Junior Infrastructure Engineer</em> requires 0-2 years of the following<p><br></p><em>Server Infrastructure Engineer</em> requires 2-5 years of the following<p><br></p><em>Senior Infrastructure Engineer</em> requires 5+ years of the following<p><br></p><ul><li>Hands-on administration and troubleshooting experience with blade, rack-mount, and virtual server infrastructure</li><li>Experience with server management products such as Cisco UCS Central, Lenovo xClarity Administrator, or Dell OpenManage Enterprise</li><li>Practical application of scripting languages such as PowerShell, Go, or Python</li><li>Server resource capacity management and system tuning</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Preferred Skills And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Cisco's Unified Computing System (B/C Series and Fabric Interconnects), Dell, or Lenovo servers</li><li>Knowledge of VMware HA, DRS, and server/storage VMotion</li><li>Experience troubleshooting Server side SAN and network configurations</li><li>Experience in replacing CPUs, DIMMs, power supplies, or other server hardware</li><li>Certifications in one or more of the following is a plus VCP, CCNA-DC, CCNP-DC</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Relocation to Madison, WI (reimbursed)</li><li>Eligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul><p><br></p>As a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. description: As a Server Systems Engineer, you will enable our customers to keep their systems up and running in optimal condition so that they can provide amazing care with the help of our software. Unlike other customer service roles, this position will truly challenge even the most seasoned technical employee to troubleshoot and problem solve deep within the code. You’ll have a hand in the development of tools to support operating systems, troubleshoot and debug in the already established code, and monitor overall system health for some of the largest healthcare organizations in the industry. You will work alongside customer analysts and database administrators (DBA) to deploy and maintain the platform that Epic runs on ensuring that healthcare organizations are able to provide around-the-clock care.<p><br></p>Being one of the first teams at Epic to work with new customers, you’ll be designing their server infrastructure and building their database from scratch. That relationship will continue over their lifetime with Epic, as you make your customers successful by providing them with the right tools and supporting them in crises. You’ll guide them through disaster and contingency plan creation, develop and share expert knowledge in systems and database administration, coordinate with third party hardware vendors, and have the opportunity to work with systems on a scale that is pushing the edge of technology.<p><br></p>The work our Server Systems team does touches every area of Epic—you’ll have opportunities to collaborate with developers, technical support, software testers, and implementation specialists across the company. You’ll be able to focus and grow your skills in at least one of those areas—we have scripters and documentation specialists, developers and technical support gurus. You’ll build valuable industry-wide skills within the field of Information Technology doing high stakes, critical work that allows healthcare providers to better do what they do best take great care of patients.<p><br></p><strong>More than just important work.</strong><p><br></p>Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Math, Physics, Engineering, MIS, or other hard science preferred</li><li>A history of academic and professional success</li><li>Knowledge of UNIX, Linux, Windows, database management systems, or scripting in Perl or Korn shell is a plus, but is not necessary</li><li>Eligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship</li><li>Relocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)</li><li>COVID-19 vaccination</li></ul>
